description.narrative: Supporting the Economic Empowerment of Afghan Women through Education and Training in Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

comment.narrative: The need to facilitate the development of a sustainable system of exchange education that will allow women from Afghanistan to benefit from higher education opportunities in Central Asia also beyond the project lifetime. The challenges for Afghan women to gain higher education within Afghanistan in terms of easy access, availability of accommodation, and range of faculty options exacerbated by the lack of qualified specialists. The lack of employment opportunities for Afghan women in Afghanistan.
1. Scholarships are awarded to Afghan women in selected areas; 2. Foundation training in languages and cultures of the host countries for potential applicants developed and implemented.

1.1. Launch of the project with national partners 1.2. Selection of TVET and language programmes and institutions in consultation with national partners and UNDP Afghanistan office. 1.3.Preparation of the documents for enrollment to language and TVET programme and arranging formalities between ministry of higher education in Uzbekistan and Afghanistan. 1.4. Announce a language training and TVET programme for Afghan women in cooperation with UNDP Afghanistan. 1.5. Selection of 10 Afghan women for main list and 5 for reserve list. 1.6. Arranging logistics, visa, travel, dormitory and other registration formalities for selected candidates. 1.7. Signing contracts with institutions for payment of tuition fees and stipends for 10 students 1.8. Regular consultations meetings and monitoring of progress with national partners, UNDP Kazakhstan and UNDP Afghanistan offices as well EUD and Embassy of Afghanistan in Tashkent.

The Regional Project was launched in Uzbekistan on July 10, 2020. The main goal of this project in Uzbekistan is to provide a more efficient delivery of Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) for Afghan Women due to the proximity and the experience of the government and higher education institutions in providing international exchange education. The priority sector for education is agriculture as a growth sector with particular importance for promoting gender equality. Ten Afghan Women with a high school diploma (complete 12 years) wishing to enhance their professional skills via TVET programme in Agronomy will be awarded educational grants. On 8 June 2020, the Action Plan was signed between UNDP in Uzbekistan and the Ministry of Higher and Secondary Specialized Education of Uzbekistan (MHSSE), which was nominated a main national implementing partner of the project. The Educational Center for Training Afghan Citizens in Termez (ECTAC) was identified as a responsible partner institution for training 10 Afghan women under the TVET program in the field of agronomy, which is the most suitable for these purposes. Memorandum of Understanding between the UNDP and MHSSE on the implementation of the project in Uzbekistan was signed. The memorandum outlines the key parameters and areas of cooperation between UNDP, MHSSE and educational institution on delivering the training programme for Afghan women. On 21 July 2020, the launch of the 2020 application process for education grants for Afghan women to study in Uzbekistan was announced. Extensive media coverage of the process was ensured including via official websites of the project partners in Uzbekistan and Afghanistan. Promotional materials were published in more than 25 national media outlets of Afghanistan and Uzbekistan, as well as in the popular Afghan communities on Facebook in five languages (Dari, Pashto, English, Russian and Uzbek). The Selection Committee was formed by the representatives of TVET Administration of Afghanistan, MHSSE of Uzbekistan, Embassy of Uzbekistan in Afghanistan, UNDP Country Offices in Afghanistan and Uzbekistan. The selection of participants for the TVET Program has been conducted in three stages: 1. Review of applications and analysis of the high school marks of the participants (grades 10-12) with focus on Chemistry and Biology, as well as English. In total, 97 applications were received for participation in the TVET program. Based on the screening, a long list of 68 Afghan women was formed to be invited to the written test in English. 2. Written test of English took place on 27 August 2020 in the building of the Afghan TVET Administration in Kabul. The test included 35 questions on grammar, vocabulary, and reading. Two variants of the questionnaire were offered to the participants. A total of 38 applicants participated in the written exam and 35 of them were short-listed for an interview. 3. Interviews with the Selection Committee members – to evaluate the participants’ English speaking skills, overall level of knowledge and motivation – were conducted on 7 and 9 September 2020 remotely through the Zoom platform. The applicants connected from the office of the Afghan Ministry of Womens Affairs in Kabul. Based on the interview results, 10 winners of the TVET competition have been selected, as well as a reserve list of 5 candidates (in case some of the winners are unable to participate). The corresponding protocol was signed by all members of the Selection Committee on 14 September 2020. At the same time, there were some changes in the list of the participants. Three successful contestants have decided to quit the program citing newly emerged personal circumstances. Based on the selection rules, the vacant spots have been filled by three candidates from the reserve list of winners. The winners of the competition are women of different ages – ranging from 17 to 27 –representing six provinces of Afghanistan. All 10 Afghan students underwent the necessary procedures at the TVET Administration of Afghanistan, passed the COVID-19 test in Kabul, and arrived in Tashkent on December 4. Student visas for the Afghan women have been provided by the Government of Uzbekistan free of charge. After passing the quarantine measures for COVID-19, they are ready to start basic training under the TVET program. During the quarantine period, students were provided with a new laptop for distance learning. In addition, all of them are covered by medical insurance, including on COVID-19, for the entire period of study in Uzbekistan. In the first year of education, the students will study the Uzbek language and receive orientation on the TVET program. From September 2021 to June 2023, the Afghan women will undergo a TVET curriculum in agriculture in partnership with educational institutions of Uzbekistan. In July 2023, the first cohort of Afghan women will be awarded TVET diplomas.
